metadata.title: CVE-2018-18504 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A crash and out-of-bounds read can occur when the buffer of a textureclient is freed while it is still in use during graphic operations. Thisresults is a potentially exploitable crash and the possibility of readingfrom the memory of the freed buffers. This vulnerability affects Firefox <65.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18504` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 65.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 65.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 65.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 65.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '65.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52 package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
